data.name: Who can still win the league
data.description:
Who can still win.
You will be given list of match results in a form of string.
You only count with teams that are mentioned in match list.
```python
"TeamA-TeamB>TeamA TeamC-TeamA>TeamC TeamB-TeamC>TeamB TeamB-TeamA>TeamA"
```
Team names divided by '-' is the matchup and the team behind '>' is the winner.
Winning team gets 1 point.
Every team plays each other 2 times.
Winner of the whole league is the team with the highest amount of points in case of 2 or more teams tied on points minitable will be formed consisting only of the results between the tied teams.
If even after minitable the teams are tied then each team will split equally the 1 scenario.(meaning if 2 teams tie they both get 0.5)

Your task is to return the teams that can still place 1st in a list sorted by number of scenarios they are placed 1st.
If 2 or more teams have the same amount of scenarios they are sorted alphabetically.

Example:
```python
"TeamA-TeamB>TeamA TeamC-TeamA>TeamC TeamB-TeamC>TeamB TeamB-TeamA>TeamA"
```
After those games played.
  TeamA has 2 points
  TeamB has 1 point
  TeamC has 1 point
And the matches left to play are.
  TeamA vs TeamC
  TeamC vs TeamB
There are 4 scenarios that can happen.
  If TeamA beats TeamC it doesnt matter how will the second match end so TeamA has 2 scenarios.
  But if Team C wins both matches they will win giving them also 1 scenario.
  The last scenarios of TeamC beating TeamA and then loosing to TeamB threeway tie will happen
  with all teams on 2 points and since there is no reason to build a minitable between the teams they will 
  split the point.

The final result will be.

```python
["TeamA", "TeamC", "TeamB"]
```
Since TeamA has 2 + 1/3, TeamC has 1 + 1/3 and TeamB has 1/3 of a scenario when they win.


The maximum amount of teams will be 7.
